channel.title: People on Computational Quantum Science
channel.description: Recent content in People on Computational Quantum Science

item.title: Ali Can Yildirim
item.author: bWFya3VzLnNjaG1pdHRAZnotanVlbGljaC5kZQ== (Markus Schmitt)
item.description: Hi, I am Ali! For my master’s thesis, I am investigating the ability of neural networks to find the ground state of correlated fermionic systems. The overarching goal is to better understand the breakdown of superconductivity in disordered superconducting systems.

item.title: Noé Salmeron
item.author: bWFya3VzLnNjaG1pdHRAZnotanVlbGljaC5kZQ== (Markus Schmitt)
item.description:
Hi, I’m Noe!

I’m currently focused on developing efficient numerical techniques to simulate and study Floquet systems. My work involves leveraging machine learning methods, particularly neural network quantum states, together with theoretical insights to improve these simulations. More broadly, I’m interested in numerical approaches for studying complex systems in quantum physics.

Short CV
since 2024 PhD student at University of Regensburg and IMPRS-QDC
2022-2024 Master in physics at EPFL
2019-2022 Bachelor in physics at EPFL

item.title: Moksh Bhateja
item.author: bWFya3VzLnNjaG1pdHRAZnotanVlbGljaC5kZQ== (Markus Schmitt)
item.description:
Hello!! I’m Moksh, a master’s student with academic interests in theoretical and computational condensed matter physics, the dynamics of quantum many-body systems, and machine learning. Currently, I am researching the evolution and dynamics of quantum systems, focusing on the spatial and temporal behavior of entanglement in many-body systems through an information theory framework. Recreationally, I enjoy watching movies, listening to music, traveling, swimming, and drawing portraits.

Short CV
since 2024 Intern at FZ Jülich (PGI-8) and University of Regensburg, Germany
2024 Intern at Queen’s University, Canada
2024 Intern at Lille University & Sorbonne University, France
2023 Intern at Jet Propulsion Laboratory - NASA, Caltech
since 2020 B.Tech.+Masters in Solid State Physics at Indian institute of Space Science and Technology (IIST)

item.title: Nikita Alert
item.author: bWFya3VzLnNjaG1pdHRAZnotanVlbGljaC5kZQ== (Markus Schmitt)
item.description:
Hi, I am Nikita.

I am a Master student and for my project I will use neural networks to efficeinty store wave functions of many body systems. I am just starting, but ready to go down the rabbit hole.

Short CV
2023 -      Studies at the University of Cologne, Master in Computational Sciences (Condensed Matter Physics)
2019 – 2023    Studies at the University of Cologne, Bachelor in Physics

item.title: Jonas Rigo
item.author: bWFya3VzLnNjaG1pdHRAZnotanVlbGljaC5kZQ== (Markus Schmitt)
item.description:
Hi, I’m Jonas and currently I am a Postdoc in the Computational Quantum Science Research Group. I am interested in quantum many-body physics, ranging from condensed matter systems to quantum simulators. In my research I investigate modern machine learning methods that can potentially provide unprecedented insights into quantum many-body systems. In my free time I enjoy yoga, books and all possible ways to get up and down a mountain.

Short CV
since 2023 Postdoc at FZ Jülich (PGI-8)
2019-2023 PhD in physics at University College Dublin
2013-2018 Bachelor and Master in physics at University of Innsbruck

item.title: Francesca de Franco
item.author: bWFya3VzLnNjaG1pdHRAZnotanVlbGljaC5kZQ== (Markus Schmitt)
item.description:
Hi, I am Francesca!

My research focuses on digital quantum simulations of quantum many-body systems. As a concrete example, I investigate the Floquet random circuit, a model used to study many-body localization. We employ variational methods to optimize the circuit for targeted quantum devices, reducing the circuit depth and enhancing their suitability for NISQ devices.

I am also interested in the dynamics of quantum many-body systems in non- equilibrium settings, such as the dynamics at first-order and continuous quan- tum transitions, whether they evolve unitarily or interact with environments.

Short CV
since 2023 PhD student at FZ Jülich (PGI-8) and University of Regensburg
2020-2022 Master in Physics at the University of Pisa
2018-2020 Bachelor in Physics at the University of Calabria

item.title: Mo Abedi
item.author: bWFya3VzLnNjaG1pdHRAZnotanVlbGljaC5kZQ== (Markus Schmitt)
item.description:
Hi, I am Mo!

My research interests lie at the crossroads between machine learning and quantum computing and quantum matter. I am currently writing my Masters thesis applying reinforcement learning for optimal quantum control. Aside from that, I am trying to do generative modelling and representation learning for learning quantum complexity.

item.title: Wladislaw Krinitsin
item.author: bWFya3VzLnNjaG1pdHRAZnotanVlbGljaC5kZQ== (Markus Schmitt)
item.description:
Hi, I am Wladi!

In my current research I am working on simulating non-equilibrium dynamics using machine learning and other techniques from many-body physics. Further topics I am interested in include non-abelian gauge theories, especially approaches to the low energy sector of QCD.

item.title: Markus Schmitt
item.author: bWFya3VzLnNjaG1pdHRAZnotanVlbGljaC5kZQ== (Markus Schmitt)
item.description:
Short CV
since 2023 Independent research group leader at University of Regensburg
since 2022 Junior group leader at FZ Jülich (PGI-8)
2020-2022 Postdoc at University of Cologne
2018-2020 Postdoc at UC Berkeley ( Leopoldina Felloship)
2018 Postdoc at MPI PKS
2015-2018 PhD in Physics at the University of Göttingen
2009-2014 Studied physics and high performance computing in Göttingen and Edinburgh.
